Forwarded from: Arab Africa

event: Termination of Sperm Whale Repair Contract
description: The Russian Ministry of Defense will pay Zvezdochka Ship Repair Center 1.101 billion rubles for the terminated contract to repair and modernize the nuclear deep-sea station Sperm Whale. The contract was signed in 2005, and Zvezdochka invested 11 billion rubles, but only received 9.9 billion rubles from the Ministry of Defense.
original:
Forwarded from: Fuel Oil Soot
April 10, 2024 Zvezdochka will receive 1.1 billion rubles for the terminated contract for the repair of the Sperm Whale. The Russian Ministry of Defense will pay the Zvezdochka Ship Repair Center 1.101 billion rubles, which the company invested in the repair and modernization of the nuclear deep-sea station of the Sperm Whale series.

The contract for the modernization of the underwater station was signed back in 2005. During this time, the Zvyozdochka shipbuilding center (part of the United Shipbuilding Corporation, USC) spent about 11 billion rubles on repairs and modernization of the station, and the Ministry of Defense transferred only 9.9 billion rubles to the enterprise. The Moscow Arbitration Court considered that Zvezdochka should receive the remaining amount from the customer. The decision was made on March 29.

“Zvezdochka” carried out the work at project 19100, serial number 402B, the case file says. Judging by the data from the RussianShips.info directory, we are talking about Soviet nuclear deep-sea stations of the Sperm Whale project. The serial number 402 corresponds to the AS-15 station, which became part of the fleet in 1991.

Details about what exactly the modernization should have been are not given in the text of the court decision; it is only indicated that Zvezdochka was tasked with installing and testing various samples of systems and complexes.

Initially, it was assumed that Zvezdochka would complete the modernization by 2010, then the deadline was moved to December 31, 2016.

Apparently, the chances of completing everything on time were initially high - in the summer of 2015, Zvezdochka entered the stage of mooring tests. Acceptance tests would then be completed and the project would be completed. However, the mooring tests could not be completed - the pressure glands at the facility failed (they are used to protect the cable entry point).

As a result, it was decided to replace the pressure seals throughout the entire facility. By December 2018, after carrying out this work, the AS-15 was ready to begin testing, but due to difficult weather conditions it was not possible to go to sea. The station was sent to the boathouse, and on July 5, 2019, Zvezdochka received a letter from the leadership of the military unit to which the facility was assigned, from which it followed that a ban was being introduced on the operation of two types of lithium-ion batteries due to an accident at another facility.

It should be noted that on July 1, 2019, a fire occurred at the AS-31 deep-sea station, known as Losharik. 14 submariners were killed, RIA Novosti reported. As follows from the text of the court decision, the same batteries must be installed on the AS-15 as on the AS-31.

Zvezdochka attempted to find alternative equipment, but failed to replace the batteries. In this regard, in November 2020, Zvezdochka sent a letter to the Ministry of Defense to suspend the work under the government contract in this part. The Ministry of Defense held a series of meetings and decided to terminate the government contract for the work actually completed, taking into account the profitability of Zvezdochka.

The further fate of the AS-15 is unclear. In March 2021, TASS, citing its own sources, wrote that the AS-15 could be carried by the Belgorod nuclear submarine. The Mill.Press.Flot portal drew attention to the fact that in 2022 there was no information about the status of the AS-15 deep-sea station. Information and analytical portal "Industry News MASHNEWS" "Zvezdochka" will receive 1.1 billion rubles for the terminated contract for the repair of "Sperm Whale" »The Russian Ministry of Defense will pay the Zvezdochka Ship Repair Center 1.101 billion rubles, which the company invested in the repair and modernization of the nuclear deep...

description: Roscosmos successfully conducted the first test launch of the Angara-A5 heavy-duty launch vehicle from the Vostochny cosmodrome. The rocket performed normally, separating the upper stage from the third stage and injecting the test payload into the desired orbit. This launch marked the beginning of flight development tests of the Amur space rocket complex with Angara heavy-class launch vehicles.
original:
04/11/24. Relevant.
"
Roscosmos publishes beautiful footage and chronology of the first test launch of the Angara-A5 heavy-duty launch vehicle from the Vostochny cosmodrome.
Show more
Today at 12:00:00 Moscow time the Angara-A5 launched with the Orion upper stage and a test payload.
The rocket performed normally, the upper stage separated from the third stage of the rocket and is currently injecting the test payload into the desired orbit!
This launch began flight development tests of the Amur space rocket complex with Angara heavy-class launch vehicles at Vostochny.
"Angara-A5" is a Russian heavy-class launch vehicle of the Angara family, the first heavy launch vehicle developed in Russia after the collapse of the USSR.
The main task of operating the Angara-A5 launch vehicle is to launch modern and promising heavy spacecraft into high-energy orbits - geostationary (communications satellites, weather satellites, spacecraft in the interests of the Ministry of Defense), flight trajectories to the Moon and departure trajectories (AMS). Increasing the payload mass to 25-37 tons relative to the currently operated heavy Proton launch vehicle (payload up to 22 tons in low Earth orbit) will significantly increase and expand the capabilities of promising spacecraft.”

description: Despite losses, the Russian army in Ukraine has grown by 15% since the invasion, with the number of frontline troops increasing from 360,000 to 470,000. This growth is attributed to Russia raising the conscription age from 27 to 30, allowing for an additional 2 million military conscripts in the coming years.
original:
"ANGRY AND DEADLY"

The Russian army in Ukraine has grown during the war, despite losses, NATO's Supreme Allied Commander Europe, Christopher Cavoli, told a congressional hearing.

Now it is 15% more than at the time of the invasion, Business Insider reports his words.

“Over the past year, Russia has increased the number of its frontline troops from 360,000 to 470,000,” Cavoli said, linking this to Russia raising the conscription age from 27 to 30.

This increase, according to the general, means that Russia will be able to increase “the number of available military conscripts by 2 million in the coming years.”

“Overall, Russia is on track to command the largest army on the continent. Regardless of the outcome of the war in Ukraine, Russia will be bigger, deadlier and angrier at the West than during the invasion,” Cavoli said in his opening statement.

event: Excursion for SVO Participants and Families
description: On April 11, 2024, an excursion was held at the Moscow theater Et Cetera for SVO participants, their families, and members of the 'Veterans of Russia' Movement and the Interregional public organization 'Pilgrim'. The event was led by artist and assistant director Timofey Dunaev and included a tour of the theater, its history, and a prop-making demonstration.
original: On April 11, 2024, an excursion for SVO participants and members of their families was held at the Moscow theater Et Cetera@theatre_etcetera. The theater held it together with the All-Russian public movement "VETERANS OF RUSSIA", which actively provides assistance to military personnel, volunteers and their families. The excursion was attended by participants of a special military operation, members of their families, members of the "Veterans of Russia" Movement and the Interregional public organization "Pilgrim" . The leader of the excursion is artist and assistant director Timofey Dunaev. During a walk around the theater, guests learned the history of the creation of Et Cetera, the meaning of its name, visited the Big and Small halls, looked into the artistic dressing rooms, got acquainted with the artistic and production part of the theater, and visited the prop shop. There, the deputy head of the theater's production workshops, Pavel Ukhlin, told and showed adults and children how to create props for performances. The "Veterans of Russia" movement expresses special gratitude to the artistic director of the Moscow theater "Et Cetera", People's Artist of the Russian Federation, laureate of USSR State Prizes Alexander Alexandrovich Kalyaginuz provided the opportunity to visit the theater with the children of participants in a special military operation with an interesting excursion and the provision of tickets to theater performances. The head of the Central Office of the Veterans of Russia Movement, Viktor Bashkatov, handed over commemorative gingerbread cookies and mugs with the emblem of the Movement and the Veterans Assault Brigade to the representative of the Et Cetera theater, Angelina Veveris.@veteranrossii_online

event: Nun Keeps Friend's Remains in Suitcase
description: An 80-year-old nun in Chile kept the skeleton of her friend, who died in April 2023, in a suitcase for a year. She claimed they had promised to stay together even in death. The remains were discovered by a garbage recycler who reported an unpleasant odor.
original:
Friendship to the grave: the nun did not want to part with her friend after death and kept her remains in her suitcase for a year

The police found out about a madwoman walking the streets of Chile with the skeleton of her friend by accident. Thus, an 80-year-old nun forgot a suitcase with human bones near her house - after smelling an unpleasant odor, a garbage recycler found it.

The woman told police that she and her friend, who died in April 2023, promised each other to stay together even if they died.

As the media write, the nun will not be held accountable - she will get off with a fine. Subscribe to REN TV

event: Strike on Trypillya Thermal Power Plant
description: Russian forces used the latest X-69 missiles to strike the Trypillya Thermal Power Plant, with a launch range of approximately 400 km. This exceeds the previously known maximum range of 300 km. The effective use of these subsonic stealth cruise missiles against a critical target near the Ukrainian capital suggests a significant depletion of enemy air defenses and the high effectiveness of the missile.
original:
Forwarded from: Military Informant
The latest X-69 missiles were used to strike the Trypillya Thermal Power Plant, Ukrainian sources say.

Conclusions about the use of the X-69 are drawn based on the debris found on the territory of the destroyed Ukrainian energy facility. At the same time, as stated, the missile launch range was about 400 km, which significantly exceeds previously known data on the maximum launch range of the Kh-69 missiles of 300 km.

This is not the first time that these latest Russian cruise missiles have been used to hit targets on Ukrainian territory. Previously, the enemy had already published a video of the collected debris of the X-69 used during one of the strikes in February 2024.

The effective use of such subsonic stealth cruise missiles, launched by tactical rather than strategic aircraft, against a critical target located right near the Ukrainian capital can indicate a significant depletion of enemy air defenses, as well as the high effectiveness of the missile itself.

Let us recall that the stealthy Kh-69 is capable of being launched by Su-30SM, Su-34, Su-35S, Su-57 aircraft, and is a more modern analogue of Western cruise missiles Storm Shadow (SCALP-EG), Taurus and AGM-158 JASSM.Military Informant

event: Re-investigation of Ural Airlines Plane Landing
description: The Rosaviation Commission completed a re-investigation of the Ural Airlines plane landing in a field near Novosibirsk. The report linked pilot mistakes to shortcomings in flight safety, management, and crew training at the airline. The pilots' decision to divert to Novosibirsk was influenced by the airline's recommendation to prioritize airports with trained technical personnel for quick malfunction resolution.
original:
Forwarded from: Aviatorism
The Rosaviation Commission has completed a re-investigation of the landing of a Ural Airlines plane in a field near Novosibirsk.

In a new report, she linked mistakes made by pilots to numerous shortcomings in flight safety, flight management and crew training at the airline.

The main factor that influenced Sergei Belov’s decision to leave for Novosibirsk instead of landing in Omsk was the carrier’s recommendation that if a malfunction occurs during the flight, go to the airport where there are trained technical personnel to eliminate the failure as quickly as possible. The pilot himself admitted this to members of the Federal Air Transport Commission. After the emergency landing in a field on September 12, the airline immediately removed this recommendation from crew briefing packets.

According to the crew’s explanations, at the time of making the decision to leave for an alternate airfield, the pilots were afraid that “they might receive a negative reaction from management” if they landed in Omsk, contrary to the company’s recommendations, where there was no opportunity to promptly fix a fault in the hydraulic system, as this could lead to delays in subsequent flights and additional costs, the report notes. In addition, a survey of ordinary flight personnel showed that pilots receive informal reprimands for mistakes and deviations (not violations). Based on the results of the investigation, the commission recommended that Ural Airlines, among other things, consider the suitability of those responsible for flight safety for their positions. We are talking about flight director Sergei Glazkov and quality director Alexei Fomin, who have been working in the company for 31 and 24 years, respectively. New_report_p...in_wheat.pdf11.1 MB·/11.1 MB

description: Antonina Martynova, accused of attempted murder of her two-year-old daughter in 2007, was detained after 16 years on the run. She is now in a pre-trial detention center, with a hearing scheduled for April 16.
original:
Antonina Martynova, accused in the resonant (but almost forgotten) “Novgorod case,” was detained. She was wanted for 16 years on charges of attempted murder of her daughter. Law enforcement officers detained Veliky Novgorod resident Antonina Martynova, who fled 16 years ago when she was tried on charges of attempted murder of her two-year-old daughter.

✹ According to the agency’s interlocutor, Martynova, together with her daughter Alisa, were on the federal wanted list “until March 22”; Martynova is now placed in a pre-trial detention center.

✹ When, where and under what circumstances she was detained is not specified. A hearing in Martynova’s case is scheduled in the Novgorod Regional Court for April 16. Nothing is reported about Alice's fate either.

✹ Antonina Martynova (Fedorova) is accused in the “Novgorod case”, which was opened in 2007. As reported, Martynova’s daughter Alisa (then she was two years old, and Antonina herself was 21) fell down a flight of stairs in February 2007 and received moderate injuries.

✹ According to investigators, the girl was pushed by her mother, who allegedly wanted to stage an accident. The only witness to the incident was another child, 11-year-old Yegor Kudrov; he stood on the landing on the floor above. Kudrov said that the girl fell because Martynova pushed her.

✹ The prosecution, in addition, argued that Martynova did this because her daughter from her first marriage allegedly interfered with her relationship with her second husband Kirill Martynov (now he is the editor-in-chief of Novaya Gazeta Europe; their relationship was not formalized). Antonina Martynova insisted that it was an accident.

Read more about the “Novgorod case” at the link.

Main provisions: 🔻Those recognized as partially fit must re-pass the VLK🔻Those who received II - III disability group after February 24, 2022 (except for military personnel) must undergo a repeat medical examination to determine suitability for service.🔻Ukrainians who are abroad will have to update their personal data in the TCC within 60 days. This can be done remotely by email, by phone or through an e-office🔻Restriction of the right to drive a vehicle for those evading military service🔻When checking documents, an authorized representative of the TCC or a police officer will take photo and video recording🔻It is necessary to have a military uniform with you registration document and show it at the request of a representative of the TCC, a police officer or the State Border Guard Service🔻The TCC will receive data from the Ministry of Internal Affairs about cars owned by Ukrainians and companies for their mobilization (if more than 1 car)

They plan to complete the restoration of the Donetsk sports complex "Lokomotiv" this summer. Now the builders are eliminating structural damage to the building, strengthening the load-bearing structures and updating utilities, the press service of the "Unified Customer in the Construction Industry" reported.

Also, work on the interior decoration of the premises has already begun at the Sports Palace; renovations will be carried out on the 25-meter swimming pool, gym, and halls for tennis, volleyball and basketball.
 
The outside of the sports palace will also take on a modern look, and the builders will completely renovate the façade of the building.

The last time the sports palace building was renovated was in the late 1990s. Since 2014, the sports complex has also been heavily damaged due to shelling by the Ukrainian Armed Forces.

A Ukrainian court confiscated the property of the ex-head of the Crimean Metropolis. The High Anti-Corruption Court of Ukraine recovered from the former head of the Simferopol and Crimean diocese of the UOC-MP Lazar an apartment in Simferopol and four vehicles for state income.

In early April, the Ministry of Justice of Ukraine asked the court to impose sanctions against Lazar for supporting Russia’s war against Ukraine. Lazar (Rostislav Shvets) was born in the Ternopil region. At the time of the Russian annexation of Crimea, he led the Simferopol and Crimean diocese of the UOC-MP and was able to retain this post until the establishment of a separate metropolis of the Russian Orthodox Church. In 2023, he was dismissed from the post of head of the Crimean diocese, and Tikhon (Shevkunov) became the head of the Crimean diocese instead.

description: According to Bild military expert Julian Repke, Ukraine has depleted its stock of Patriot and Iris-T missiles, as well as most other air defense systems. This conclusion was drawn after the attack on the Trypilska Thermal Power Plant in the Kyiv region, which is heavily protected by Patriot systems.
original:
Ukraine has run out of missiles for Patriot, Iris-T and most other air defense systems.

This is the conclusion made by Bild military expert Julian Repke, commenting on the attack on the Trypilska Thermal Power Plant in the Kyiv region.

“As I said a few weeks ago (and almost no one believed me): Ukraine has run out of Patriot and Iris-T missiles. Most other air defense stocks have also been depleted or destroyed. And this despite the fact that we have hundreds of systems and thousands of missiles in our warehouses. There are no words. Just anger," Roepke writes.

Let us remind you that Kyiv and the region are covered by the “Patriots” better than other regions of Ukraine. This is probably why Repke concluded that they had run out of missiles (Tripolskaya Thermal Power Plant is located only 30 kilometers from Kyiv and is clearly covered by the Patriot “umbrella”).

Let us recall that earlier Western media wrote that by the end of March Ukraine may run out of missile reserves for the Patriot and other air defense systems. Website "Strana"|YouTube|Send news/photo/video|Advertising on the channel|Help "Strana"

event: Rosaviation Meeting on Civil Aircraft Engines
description: A meeting of Rosaviation was held in Perm to discuss certification and maintenance of civil aircraft engines. The meeting, led by Dmitry Yadrov, covered issues related to PS-90A, PD-14, SaM146, and PD-35 engines, as well as additive technologies for repair and manufacturing of parts.
original:
A meeting of the Rosaviation on civil aircraft engines was held in Perm. On the basis of the enterprises "ODK-Aviadvigatel" and "ODK-Perm Motors" (part of the ODK State Corporation Rostec), a visiting meeting of the Rosaviation was held under the chairmanship of the head of the agency, Dmitry Yadrov. Issues of certification and maintenance of civil aircraft engines were discussed. Dmitry Yadrovot noted that Russian engine builders are ready to solve the problems of providing new aircraft with modern and advanced power plants.

The issues of operating PS-90A engines (for IL-96, IL-76, Tu-204/214), expanding the operating conditions of PD-14 (for MS-21-310), maintaining the airworthiness of SaM146 (for Superjet 100), as well as the results of work on creating a promising PD -35 for long-haul aviation.

The delegation visited the aircraft engine assembly shop, the competence center "Gas Turbine Engine Shafts" and got acquainted with additive technologies for repair and manufacturing of parts.

event: Terrorist Attack at Oktyabrskaya Metro Station
description: On April 11, 2011, a terrorist attack occurred at the Oktyabrskaya metro station in Minsk, killing 15 people and injuring over 300. The bomb, weighing at least 12.5 kilograms, was remotely detonated and was concealed in a bag. The attack was carried out during peak hours, and the perpetrators were later sentenced to death.
original:
On April 11, 2011 at 17:55 in Minsk, a terrorist attack was committed at the Oktyabrskaya metro station, an explosion occurred, which claimed the lives of 15 people and injured more than 300 people.

This is the busiest metro station; the terrorist attack was deliberately carried out at its peak.

The bomb charge was placed in two plastic bottles with a total volume of at least 12 liters. The means of concealment and delivery of the bomb is a bag with a volume of at least 15 liters. The bomb used an explosive charge that weighed at least 12.5 kilograms, an electric detonator and a safety system. It was activated remotely.

As a participant in those events, I remember very well the scale of the measures tested by all law enforcement agencies. The terrorist turned out to be from Vitebsk.

On November 30, 2011, the Supreme Court of Belarus sentenced the organizer of the terrorist attack, Dmitry Konovalov, and his accomplice, Vladislav Kovalev, to death. On March 18, 2012, the death sentences were carried out.@belarusian_silovik

event: Round Table on Russian Empire's Victory over Napoleonic France
description: A round table discussion was held at the Public Chamber of the Russian Federation to commemorate the 210th anniversary of the capture of Paris and the final victory over Napoleon. The event highlighted the role of various ethnic groups, including Russian Germans, in the Patriotic War of 1812 and emphasized the importance of unity in defending the fatherland.
original:
At the Public Chamber of the Russian Federation, a round table was held on the topic “The role of the peoples of the Russian Empire in the victory over Napoleonic France: lessons from history,” timed to coincide with the 210th anniversary of the capture of Paris and the final victory over Napoleon on March 31, 1814. Nikolay Parkhitko, associate professor of the Department of Theory and History of Journalism at RUDN University, acted as my co-speaker at the event.
Show more
When we talk about our victory, we are talking about the victory of the Russian people. At the same time, it does not matter at all what ethnic group the warriors belonged to, whose courage and dedication ensured this victory. The famous Barclay de Tolly, for example, was an ethnic German, but for all of us he is a Russian commander, in spirit and in essence.
Therefore, together with Nikolai Parkhitko, they talked about the Russian Germans and their contribution to the Patriotic War of 1812, about the patriotism of prominent representatives of the Otese German nobility, and about the activities of the Russian-German Legion.
The key idea of our speech can be expressed in a quote from the Livonian educator and publicist Harlib Merkel, formulated in his appeal “To the inhabitants of the Baltic provinces of Russia”: “We are all Russians! We don’t want to be anyone else!” Despite his German origin, he called on his fellow citizens to unite to “defend the fatherland from the foreign, shameful yoke,” forgetting about any differences.
So, the Russian army, consisting of representatives of all the peoples inhabiting the Empire, defeated Napoleon’s “Great” army and liberated Russia and Europe.
Today, when history repeats itself and the Collective West does not sleep, it is worth remembering that everyone who shares with us the values and spirituality of Russia is our Russian brothers. As the Romans said, now is the time to build bridges, not walls.

description: Russia launched a massive attack on Ukraine, firing over 40 missiles and 40 attack drones. Ukrainian air defense forces managed to shoot down some of the rockets and drones, but not all. Critical infrastructure in Kharkiv, Kyiv, Zaporizhzhia, Odesa, and Lviv was targeted.
original:
Forwarded from: Zelenskiy / Official
I am grateful to everyone who is now eliminating the consequences of the Russian attack, and to every soldier of our air defense who was on duty at night. More than 40 missiles and about 40 attack drones. Some of the rockets and "shaheeds" were shot down. Unfortunately, only a part.

Russian terrorists once again targeted critical infrastructure. There was another vile missile attack on Kharkiv and the Kharkiv region. Objects in other regions were also targeted: Kyiv, Zaporizhzhia, Odesa, and Lviv.

Each of our neighbors in Europe, each of our other partners sees how critical Ukraine's need for air defense is. Right here, right now, precisely with our ability to overcome Russian terror, the world can prove that everyone equally perceives terror as a crime. If Russia is allowed to continue to do this, if Russian missiles and "shaheds" will hit not only Ukraine, but also at the determination of its partners, this will be a global license for terror.

Air defense and other defense support are needed, not turning a blind eye and long discussions.

Thank you to everyone in the world who really effectively supports our Ukrainian struggle for life. Thank you to all the leaders who will not remain silent, who will continue to help us and condemn Russian terror.🇺🇦🇺🇦🇺🇦

description: The new JSC Rusatom Korsakov Shipyard aims to produce up to 50 ships per year, catering to the tourism, transport, and fishing industries. The shipyard will build modern vessels, including high-speed catamarans, passenger catamarans, sailing catamarans, and fishing vessels.
original:
The new enterprise JSC Rusatom Korsakov Shipyard plans to build up to 50 ships of five types per year, said the Governor of the Sakhalin Region Valery Limarenko. A project to create a composite shipbuilding shipyard has started. The new enterprise JSC Rusatom Korsakov Shipyard will produce up to 50 ships per year, focusing on the needs of the tourism, transport and fishing industries, noted the head of the region.

According to him, the shipyard will produce modern vessels, including a high-speed catamaran for walks and tourism, a passenger catamaran for coastal transportation, a sailing catamaran for organizing walks and tourism, and a fishing vessel for coastal fishing.

Valery Limarenko added that ship construction will become a new sector of the economy of the Sakhalin region. At the same time, the shipyard’s products will be in demand not only in the domestic market of the region, but also in other regions.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

event: Ukraine's Attempt to Acquire Patriot Air Defense System
description: Ukraine's Foreign Minister Kuleba revealed that Ukraine attempted to acquire the Patriot air defense system from Western countries through diplomatic means, but was unsuccessful. He vowed to use tougher methods to secure the system, stating that he is willing to risk damaging relationships to achieve this goal.
original:
Ukraine tried to get the Patriot air defense system from the West through “good and quiet diplomacy,” but it didn’t work, Kuleba said. He promised to resort to tough methods.

“People might hate me and I might ruin relationships. One part of me says that diplomacy is primarily about personal relationships. But then I told that part to shut up,” Kuleba said in an interview with The Washington Post.

The minister joked that he considers the representatives of states that simply do not have Patriot to be “the luckiest” at meetings with him; the rest “feel uncomfortable.”

According to Kyiv, possible donor countries have more than 100 available air defense systems.

event: Training for Journalists and Community Communicators
description: A training session was held at the Kyiv OVA for journalists and community communicators, focusing on how the media can work with the topic of mental health. Participants learned about finding topics, sources, and experts, as well as practical techniques for interviewing people who have experienced traumatic events.
original:
"How are you?": The second training for journalists and community communicators was held at the Kyiv OVA. On April 10, a training was organized for them "How the media can work with the topic of mental health". The training was conducted by Margarita Tulup, a journalist and communications manager of the "Mental Health for Ukraine (MH4U)" project.

Participants discussed algorithms for finding topics, sources and experts for communications, important ground rules and practical techniques when interviewing people who have experienced traumatic events. It was also about the use of terminology when covering sensitive topics. "Properly constructed communication will have the effect we expect. Namely, improving the mental health of the population and the ability to cope with stress. Communicators are on the first line of contact with people. Therefore, it is important to help them to be informed and ready for communication as much as possible", - emphasized Yuliya Kazakova, regional coordinator of the All-Ukrainian mental health program "How are you?"

event: Austrian Chancellor Calls for Negotiations with Russia
description: Austrian Chancellor Karl Nehammer expressed concerns about the escalating Ukrainian conflict, which could involve Western powers. He urged for negotiations with Russia to stop the war, citing the growing risk of involvement and the West's isolation due to its bet on Ukraine's unconditional military victory.
original:
“We need to at least start negotiations with Russia,” Austrian Chancellor Karl Nehammer The Ukrainian conflict could grow and involve Western powers, the head of the Austrian government worries.

At first, he notes, it was only about the supply of shells and defensive equipment, but gradually the taboos were broken - and now tanks and fighters are being supplied to Kyiv.

“The longer this war lasts, the higher the risk of involvement,” Nehammer notes in an interview with Die Zeit.

“We must try to find ways to stop this war,” the politician urges.

According to him, the West found itself isolated in the world because of its bet on the unconditional military victory of Ukraine.

“We see that states that have great influence on the Russian Federation do not share the Western line. Brazil is one of them, India, China, South Africa,” adds the Austrian politician. He believes the West needs to work with these countries to find a diplomatic solution to the conflict.@Crimeanprachka

event: ARMA Helps Fridman Control Assets in Ukraine
description: Mikhail Fridman, with the assistance of Ukraine's National Agency for Tracing and Asset Management ARMA, continues to receive money from his assets in Ukraine. ARMA allegedly slows down or transfers Fridman's assets to companies controlled by Russian oligarchs, including Kyivstar and Morshynska.

description: Russia successfully launched the Angara-A5 rocket from the Vostochny cosmodrome, marking a significant milestone in Russian cosmonautics. This heavy-class carrier can lift loads up to 24.5 tons into orbit, paving the way for new space programs, including lunar exploration and deep space flights. The launch also boosts high-tech sectors of the economy.
original:
Forwarded from: The world today with "Yuri Podolyak"
There is the first launch of "Angara-A5" from the Vostochny cosmodrome... What does this mean for Russia... In fact, this is the most important event in Russian cosmonautics in recent decades. Firstly, “Angara” and specifically its version “Angara-A5” is the first completely new launch vehicle developed after the collapse of the USSR. Moreover, it was launched from the first purely Russian civilian cosmodrome, which will gradually replace the Baikonur spacecraft remaining in Kazakhstan.

And not just a new carrier, but also a heavy-class carrier, which, when the development program is finally completed, will make it possible to launch loads up to 37 tons into orbit (The version that launched today can lift a load weighing 24.5 tons into orbit).

And this is the most important key to a huge number of new Russian space programs, including flight and exploration of the Moon, as well as flights into deep space.

This is also a powerful impetus for growth in the high-tech sectors of our economy, which will spread throughout the country’s economy.

Congratulations to all of us on this huge achievement. And also with the fact that Angara-A5 completed the entire flight program the first time.

And this was precisely the first launch of flight design tests of the launch vehicle (engineers understand what I’m talking about. It doesn’t always work out that way. The same Musk with his “Falcon-9” had a lot of problems at the beginning). Huge respect to the specialists of Roscosmos!!! You are our pride.

event: World Meeting on Best Practices for Implementing Artificial Intelligence in Parliaments
description: The Inter-Parliamentary Union and the Brazilian Chamber of Deputies organized the first World Meeting on Best Practices for Implementing Artificial Intelligence in Parliaments in Brazil. The event brought together representatives from 15 countries and international organizations to discuss the use of AI in parliaments, present case studies, and develop innovative strategies for implementing AI systems.
original:
🇧🇷🤖🇦🇴🇿🇦🇰🇪The first World Meeting on Best Practices for Implementing Artificial Intelligence in Parliaments is taking place in Brazil from April 9 to 11. The event, organized by the Inter-Parliamentary Union in collaboration with the Brazilian Chamber of Deputies, is attended by representatives of the parliaments of three African countries: Angola, South Africa and Kenya. In addition, delegates from Brazil, Canada, Chile, Spain, Italy, the Netherlands, Norway, Great Britain, Trinidad and Tobago, the European Parliament and the Pan African Parliament are participating in the meeting.

The meeting will examine topics related to the use of generative artificial intelligence in parliaments, present case studies from the parliaments of Brazil, Italy and Norway, and propose innovative strategies for the 180 member parliaments of the IPU. An important part is the discussion of how to comply with ethical principles when developing AI-based systems for parliaments.

In addition, three working groups will be established to develop global guidance on best practices for the implementation of AI systems in parliaments. The first projects should be launched in November 2024 at the world conference on “electronic parliament”.#Africa#andTelegramAfrican looking glassNikita Panin’s channel about political processes in Africa

The author is the RIAC program coordinator and an expert at the Center for African Studies at the National Research University Higher School of Economics VIEW CHANNEL

event: Arrest and Release of Ekaterina Portnyagina
description: Ekaterina Portnyagina, wife of Dmitry Portnyagin, was arrested in Moscow after arriving from Dubai. She was detained due to the couple's massive debt to tax authorities. After 12 hours, she was released, and the couple paid off their debts of over RUB 124 million in two criminal cases for tax evasion and money laundering.
original:
Dmitry Portnyagin's wife was just released from the Investigative Committee - approximately 12 hours after her arrest. The woman disappeared from the waiting journalists through the service exit of the building and drove away in a car driven there.

In the morning we wrote that Ekaterina Portnyagina was detained in Moscow immediately after her arrival from Dubai, and security forces came to search the buildings of the Club 500 business club and the Siberia bath complex, co-founded by Dmitry. The reason was the spouses’ huge debt to the tax authorities.

Later, Portnyagin promised to pay all debts during the day, and in the evening the Investigative Committee reported that the spouses had fully compensated for damages amounting to more than RUB 124 million in two criminal cases for tax evasion on a particularly large scale and money laundering. According to investigators, from 2018 to 2020 they failed to pay more than ₽124 million in taxes and more than ₽91 million of them were transferred to the accounts of third legal entities. In addition, a debt of penalties and fines has accumulated in the amount of ₽64 million. Subscribe to SHOTSend news

 "If Ukraine stops defending itself now, it will be the end of Ukraine's existence, not this war. And the war will continue - as an attack on other countries," said the head of the German Foreign Ministry

Burbok called on members of the Bundestag to allocate additional budget funds for security policy, including support for Ukraine.

description: Russia plans to launch a spacecraft to Venus in 2031, aiming to explore the planet through contact means, including entering the atmosphere and potentially landing on its surface. The expedition is complex and will involve a landing module to take soil samples, which will operate for about a day.
original:
Russia will launch its spacecraft to Venus in 2031 “Our expedition to Venus is planned for 2031. Unfortunately, the period is quite long, but the expedition is quite complex,” said Lev Zeleny, scientific director of the Space Research Institute (IKI) of the Russian Academy of Sciences. He also noted that, unlike other countries that limit themselves to sending orbital vehicles to this planet, Russia plans to explore it by contact means. In other words, according to the plans, Russian spacecraft will enter the atmosphere of Venus, and perhaps even land on its surface.

Zeleny emphasized that after the discovery of phosphine gas in its clouds, Venus again returned to the spotlight of world astronautics, since its presence is considered one of the signs of the presence of life on the planet. Moreover, there are also guesses about the possibility of the existence of life on its surface.

It is assumed that the Venera-D project will include a landing module for taking soil samples from the planet, which will be able to operate for about a day. Initially, it was considered as a joint project with NASA, but the United States abandoned it, and Russia continued it independently.

It was also previously reported that Roscosmos and the Russian Academy of Sciences are exploring the possibility of returning to Earth samples of soil, atmosphere and aerosols of Venus as part of the Venera-V mission.

description: The European Cup Judo competition among cadets took place in Teplice, Czech Republic, on April 6-7, featuring 583 athletes under 18 from 32 countries. Ukraine's national team secured first place in the team standings, with representatives from the Donetsk region winning 2 of the 12 medals.
original:
🇪🇺Slavic judoka - bronze medalist of the European Cup Judo competition among cadets, which brought together 583 athletes under the age of 18 from 32 countries, took place on April 6-7 in the Czech city of Teplice. Representatives of the Donetsk region won 2 of the 12 medals of the national team of Ukraine, which, according to the results of the tournament, took first place in the team standings. This is about the Department of Physical Education and Sports of the Don Regional State Administration.

Arkady Samoilov, a 16-year-old judoka from the Oblast KDYUSH and ShVSM of Donetsk region, representing the Slavic community, won a bronze award in the weight category up to 90 kg. Dmytro Samoilov and Dmytro Ignatenko are the coaches of the boy, who is the master of sports of Ukraine in judo.

Congratulations on a successful performance! We wish you further success and victories!

original:
A 19-year-old athlete died at the front, where he went to pick up his father. Yesterday in Stary Oskol, Belgorod region, 19-year-old athlete Stanislav Lukin was buried.

In early February, he volunteered to go to war to help his mobilized father. On March 17, the guy was wounded, and on March 28 he died in the hospital from a traumatic brain injury, without leaving a coma.

The guy had the title of Master of Sports in boxing and was the winner of many competitions. He could have lived a successful life, but the war took away his right to happiness.@mobilizationnews

description: The AUKUS agreement between Australia, the United Kingdom, and the United States aims to share critical technologies, ensuring peace, prosperity, and freedom in the Indo-Pacific region. This alliance is vital to national security, particularly in the face of China's increasingly aggressive behavior, which threatens the free movement of goods and state sovereignty.
original: “America has long recognized the value of working with other countries to ensure peace, prosperity and freedom on the planet. The AUKUS agreement between Australia, the United Kingdom and the United States to share critical technologies represents a revival and reimagining of this American tradition and is vital to the nation's security. Given the increasingly aggressive nature of the Chinese government in the Indo-Pacific region, the free movement of goods and the sovereignty of states in the region are under threat. China benefits from free trade, but if it sets its own terms of trade, it will seriously affect the freedom of states in the Indo-Pacific region. The system ordered by the United States is becoming increasingly fragile." New interesting text by Eric Lees, an analyst at the Washington office of the Australian Strategic Policy Institute, on why the United States needs the AUKUS alliance in its confrontation with China. Read here. Illustration: Member states of the AUKUS alliance and their territorial waters.@yigal_levin

description: The Ukrainian Verkhovna Rada passed a law tightening mobilization rules, removing the right to demobilization after 36 months of service. Conscripts must update their data within 60 days, or face fines and deprivation of driving rights. Men between 18 and 60 must carry a military ID, and its absence can lead to detention.
original:
🇺🇦The most “unslave non-slaves have become even more unslave.”🤡The Ukrainian Verkhovna Rada adopted a scandalous law that tightens the rules of mobilization.

It has been discussed since the beginning of 2024. The right to demobilization after 36 months of service was removed from the document - this provision is proposed to be prescribed by a separate law. Conscripts must update their data at the territorial recruitment centers (TCC - Ukrainian military registration and enlistment offices) within 60 days. If a person does not meet this deadline, he faces a fine of 17 thousand to 22.5 thousand hryvnia (from 40 thousand to 54 thousand rubles), as well as deprivation of the right to drive a car (this is by decision of the military registration and enlistment office).🔺 Men between the ages of 18 and 60 are required to carry a military ID; his absence will be grounds for detention. It can be checked by the police, TCC workers and border guards. Also, without a military ID, those serving military service abroad will not be able to obtain a new passport. “This also applies to young men over 18 years of age who could have left Ukraine before they came of age,” explains Strana.ua. — That is, in order to be able to obtain Ukrainian documents abroad, you need to go to Ukraine and get a military ID. But since they won’t be released from Ukraine later, this doesn’t make sense.” P.S. The Kiev junta set out to kill all Ukrainian men and legalized the capture of “meat” for the front as much as possible.

Now the TCC officers will turn around with all their might. Some people will be detained and taken to the burial centers, others will come there themselves, as if to verify the data, and will remain there forever...

The only people left who will be fined are those who will sit at home, but even then they will definitely find justice for them, for example, they will allow the TsK’ashniks to open the housing and pack up the “dodgers” - I wouldn’t be surprised at all.

This is the long-awaited taste of freedom and Europeanness, right, Khokhlo-Banderaites? InfoDefense🇷🇺-SUBSCRIBE

event: Destruction of Trypillya Thermal Power Plant
description: The destruction of the Trypillya Thermal Power Plant will significantly complicate the logistics and operational aspects of the transfer of ammunition and reserves to the front in Ukraine. original: 🔥Trypillya Thermal Power Plant - EVERYTHING! The enterprise annually sold energy worth about 2 billion UAH. The destruction of the Trypillya Thermal Power Plant will significantly complicate the logistics and operational aspects of the transfer of ammunition and reserves to the front in Ukraine. The loss of a key source of energy in the region leads to the following problems: Transportation difficulties: Disruption of rail and other transport due to a lack of power supply will impede the fast and efficient logistics needed to support military operations. Impact on production: Power outages can stop or slow down operations defense industry enterprises, delaying the production and delivery of ammunition and military equipment. Communications and coordination: An energy crisis can complicate the operation of communication and control systems critical to the coordination of actions at the front and the movement of units. Life support: Restrictions on the supply of electricity will worsen the living conditions of civilians and military personnel in the rear, potentially reducing morale and combat effectiveness.@evgeniy_lisitsyn

On the eve of the Day of Remembrance of Russian Volunteers, which is celebrated in Republika Srpska on April 12, “Balkanist” spoke with a former Russian volunteer who fought in the ranks of the Second Russian Volunteer Detachment as part of the Republika Srpska Army during the civil war in Bosnia and Herzegovina 1992-1995, and in addition, the creator and editor-in-chief of the website Srpska.ru, from which many current Balkanists began their attachment to the Balkans, Alexander Kravchenko.

The American publication Politico reports that in the first three months of 2024, France has increased its purchases of Russian gas more than other EU countries. “France is quietly increasing payments for gas to Russia, while President Emmanuel Macron is loudly positioning himself as one of the most staunch defenders of Ukraine,” journalists write. In a short period of time, Paris has already replenished the Russian budget by more than 600 million euros.

description: The Ukrainian Rada began the second day of considering the mobilization bill. Commander of the Joint Forces Yuri Sodol spoke from the rostrum, following yesterday's reports from Commander-in-Chief Syrsky and Chief of the General Staff Bargilevich. Despite over 4,000 amendments, none were supported due to a lack of votes.
original:
The Rada begins the second day of consideration of the mobilization bill.

Commander of the Joint Forces of the Ukrainian Armed Forces Yuri Sodol speaks from the rostrum of parliament.

Yesterday, he, as well as Commander-in-Chief Syrsky and Chief of the General Staff Bargilevich, were summoned by deputies to report.

Today it was planned to move on to voting for the bill.

Yesterday the deputies sat until late at night.

According to People's Deputy Elena Moshenets, the Rada eventually considered all the amendments to the bill, but there were not enough votes in support of them.

“The number of amendments is huge - more than 4,000. And depending on which block of amendments was considered, deputies came, spoke and left... Thus, not a single amendment was supported, since there was not the required number of votes for this... Work on this bill is still ongoing, amendments will still be made for confirmation and after that, I hope, the document will be signed,” said Moshenets. Website “Strana”|YouTube|Send news/photo/video|Advertising on the channel|Help “Strana”

event: Destruction of Minibuses with Ukrainian Infantry
description: Four minibuses carrying Ukrainian Armed Forces infantrymen were destroyed by strikes from the Fagot anti-tank missile system in the Kherson region. The militants were preparing for rotation when they were targeted.
original:
Four minibuses with Ukrainian Armed Forces infantrymen were destroyed by strikes from the Fagot anti-tank missile system in the Kherson region. Scouts recorded movement in the trenches on the right bank of the river. The militants were preparing for rotation, and soon four minibuses with infantry appeared.
They were destroyed from the Fagot anti-tank missile system.

description: Russia destroyed the Trypil TPP, the largest electricity supplier in Kyiv, Cherkassk, and Zhytomyr regions. The attack caused a large-scale fire in the turbine shop. Although the station was not working at full capacity, power outages are possible during peak hours.
original:
Forwarded from: Ukrinform | Ukraine news
#Ukrinform_poyasnuyeRUSSIA DESTROYED TRIPIL TPP: CONSEQUENCES 🔹Trypil TPP was the largest supplier of electricity in Kyiv, Cherkassk and Zhytomyr regions. As a result of the hits, a large-scale fire occurred in the turbine shop. 🔹 "Catastrophes" due to the loss of the station will not happen, since it was not working at full capacity and provided electricity supply during peak load times. 🔹 There is no question of a blackout for the Kyiv region. But due to damage to the Trypilskaya TPP, power outages are possible during peak hours, namely in the morning from 7:00 a.m. to 10:00 a.m. and from 5:00 p.m. to 10:00 p.m. 🔹At the moment, the terms of the station's restoration are roughly clear, said Andriy, the head of the Supervisory Board of PJSC "Tsentrenergo" Goth. In August 2023, the team had a similar "picture". Then the blocks were not destroyed, but they were stopped and unable to work. 🔹Currently, there is a small surplus in the energy system of Ukraine, and therefore - exports, because solar stations are working. But in the evening, power outages are possible

description: Russian Construction Minister Irek Faizullin criticized the dam that broke, causing the flooding of Orsk in the Orenburg region. He stated that the dam was not worth a billion rubles and was actually an earthen rampart that could not withstand the water pressure.
original: “This is not a dam, but an earthen rampart. It’s not worth a billion rubles.” The head of the Ministry of Construction commented on the condition of the dam, after the break of which Orsk was flooded. Russian Construction Minister Irek Faizullin, in a conversation with journalists, criticized the dam, with the break of which the flooding of the city of Orsk in the Orenburg region began. “The dam that they talk about in Orsk is actually not a dam, a dam a billion rubles is not worth 10 kilometers. <…> The dam bore a load of about 5.5 meters [of water], in fact we received 10. With enormous speed, a huge mass of water pressed on not the dam, but the earthen rampart,” the minister said, as quoted by news agencies. The minister also called “ridiculous” the words of the director of the Spetsstroy company, Sergei Komarov, that the dam was ruined by mice, and promised "figure out". After eliminating the consequences of the flood, Faizullin promised to build a new dam. Subscribe to Dozhdya’s Telegram Watch us on YouTube

event: Attempted Attack on Rabbi Mendel Axelrod
description: On April 11, a young man of Eastern European appearance attempted to attack Rabbi Mendel Axelrod, the chief rabbi of Chisinau, near the city's main synagogue. The attacker shouted anti-Semitic remarks and swung at the rabbi, but was thwarted by a security guard.
original:
😡Game famous

Israeli media write that on Thursday, April 11, there was an attempt to attack the chief rabbi of Chisinau, Mendel Axelrod, near the building of the capital’s synagogue.

According to eyewitnesses, a young man of Eastern European appearance drove up to the main synagogue of the city and began taking photographs of the building.

In response to the security guard’s question about why he was taking a photo of the synagogue, the young man burst out with obscene language addressed to Jews and Israel.

Around the same time, Rabbi Mendel Axelrod came out of the synagogue and the young man turned his aggression towards him, shouting: “What are you doing here? Why hasn’t anyone destroyed you yet for everything that you are doing to the Palestinians?”

At some point, the young man swung his hand at the rabbi, but the strike was prevented by a security guard.
After this, the attacker retreated.

The police are now looking for him.

event: Multinational Gang Extorts Money from Children
description: A multinational gang, allegedly led by Azerbaijanis Raul Aliyev and Rafael Aliyev, has been operating in Balashikha, near Moscow, extorting money from children and beating them. The latest incident occurred on April 6, where the gang stopped two schoolchildren and demanded 2,000 rubles. When the victims' parents intervened, they were also beaten.
original:
Forwarded from: Multinational
In Balashikha, near Moscow, a multinational gang beats children and extorts money from them.

They tell us that the gang has been operating for several years; they say that the main Azerbaijanis there are Raul Aliyev and Rafael Aliyev.

The last episode occurred on April 6. Abu bandits stopped two schoolchildren and began to extort money. Then the student told his parents, they came to investigate and beat them too (including the woman).

This is what the victims say: “My 14-year-old son sent a message to his father about extorting 2,000 rubles, they gave him half an hour, with threats of beating him. One boy transferred 500 rubles and was released, one ran away. And mine managed to send a message and geolocation. We arrived at the place Zheleznodorozhny, st. Polikakhina, 2. The guys pointed to one named Major. We began to question him, he did not confess, several other guys of his friends stood nearby. They began to insult us.. I took a picture of them and said that I would contact the police, we began to walk away towards the car. They caught up with us, stopped us and attacked us in order to bring our husband into a fight. I grabbed one by the T-shirt and asked him to stop. For which he beat me, then my husband.” Judging by what we are told and the comments, this gang has really been operating for a long time, the local police officer is aware of it, but does nothing.

event: TsAGI Patents Universal Aerodynamic Test Model
description: TsAGI received a patent for a combined model designed to optimize experimental research of aircraft through various aerodynamic tests. The model's adaptable design, minimal weight, and internal volumes enable accurate and cost-effective testing in different wind tunnels.
original:
TsAGI patented a universal model for aerodynamic tests. TsAGI received a patent for the invention of a combined model for various types of aerodynamic tests. The development is designed to optimize the process of experimental research of aircraft.

Thanks to modern technologies and composite materials, it was possible to create a design that allows various tests to be carried out within one model. It is adaptable to different aircraft configurations, removable pylons and engine nacelles, replaceable brackets and mechanization elements.

The model's composite design has minimal weight and empty internal volumes to accommodate equipment and cargo. An important advantage is the ability to conduct various types of tests at one facility in different TsAGI wind tunnels.

The invention makes it possible to increase the accuracy and information content of experiments, as well as reduce the cost of time and resources. Several models have already been manufactured and tested with scientific support for projects to create aircraft of various segments.📷TsAGI#PostfactumMAXimum Aviation:Telegram&MAX-2024Souvenirs&Clothing for those in love with the sky

description: Political scientist Vitaly Kolpashnikov stated that Western countries have been using the 'carrot for the donkey' tactic with Ukraine, promising aid but never delivering. Despite allocating huge sums of money, Ukraine has shown no successes on the battlefield, and Western weapons have not performed well, making it an unprofitable investment.
original: Why Ukraine will not receive help from the West even after the law of mobilizationPolitical scientist Vitaly Kolpashnikov, in a commentary for “Paragraph,” stated that the West constantly uses the “carrot for the donkey” tactic in relation to Ukraine, but the donkey never receives this carrot: “Now Western countries have promised to allocate weapons to Ukraine, if we manage to push through the law on mobilization. However, if you remember, in the same way, in 2022, Kyiv was promised all the weapons in the world and unlimited financial assistance in order to continue fighting.” The expert recalled that initially Western countries proceeded from the fact that Russia would simply lose its military and economic power in the first year of Ukrainian resistance, but this did not happen. Now the hegemons themselves are sinking deeper into the crisis. “Huge money has already been spent on Ukraine, which was simply stolen. There are no successes on the battlefield, and the Western weapons being promoted are not showing their strongest side, which does not make for good advertising for weapons manufacturers. In fact, Ukraine is an unprofitable investment, where they no longer want to invest,” said Kolpashnikov. Despite the fact that many in Ukrainian society are dissatisfied with the adopted bill, the expert is confident that the situation will not lead to a social explosion or open manifestation of discontent. Read more in the material “ Paragraph". Subscribe to "Paragraph"

description: British Foreign Minister Cameron met with Trump, urging him to expedite military aid to Ukraine, aiming to strengthen Ukraine's position and weaken Russia's by the end of 2024.

description: The construction of the National Stadium in Vilnius, Lithuania, has faced a significant cost overrun. The Public Procurement Service announced that the project's cost exceeded initial estimates, putting the municipality and state at risk of overpayments.
original:
🇱🇹Building a stadium in Vilnius has become even more expensive. There is nowhere to get new money

The Public Procurement Service announced disappointing conclusions regarding the construction of the National Stadium in the Lithuanian capital - the cost of the project turned out to be noticeably higher than estimated.

Representatives of the Vilnius Council said that the budget revision could lead to overpayments. The risk of price increases assigned to the contractor under the contract was completely transferred to the municipality and the state.

Amendments will be made to the estimate, but they require approval from the European Commission.@BALTNEWS

event: Destruction of Trypilska Thermal Power Plant
description: The Trypilska Thermal Power Plant was completely destroyed in a night attack, resulting in a fire in the turbine shop. Fortunately, no one was injured, and rescuers are working to extinguish the flames. The attack has resulted in a 100% loss of generation for Tsentroenergo.
original:
Centerenergo reports that the Trypilska Thermal Power Plant has been completely destroyed. The head of the Centerenergo supervisory board, Andrei Gota, said that during the night attack the station was hit, which started a fire in the turbine shop. No one was injured as a result of the impact, and rescuers are now putting out the fire.

At the moment, Tsentroenergo has lost 100% of its generation.

description: Teachers from Kemerovo Lyceum No. 89 organized an online webinar for colleagues from Gorlovka School No. 10, focusing on interdisciplinary integration and tools for developing engineering competencies in students. The seminar aimed to unite teachers from Kuzbass and Donbass, sharing pedagogical experience in developing students' engineering competencies.
original:
Kuzbass organized a seminar for teachers of Gorlovka

Teachers from Kemerovo Lyceum No. 89, a member of the Consortium for the Development of School Engineering and Technology Education, organized an online webinar for colleagues from Gorlovka School No. 10.

The seminar on the topic “Interdisciplinary integration and other tools for developing engineering competencies of students” is aimed at uniting teachers from Kuzbass and Donbass. Kuzbass residents summarized their pedagogical experience in developing students’ engineering competencies and shared it with colleagues from the DPR.

Thus, Gorlovka residents learned about the formation of engineering thinking within the framework of integrated chemistry and biology lessons in a specialized class, experience working with a linguistic meme and STEAM technologies.

Source:
Kemerovo region (Kuzbass) - Press service of the Governor@Gorlowka_now

‼️🇪🇺The European Parliament will not approve the funding of the EU Council until the Patriot air defense systems are handed over to Ukraine! An unprecedented decision supported by 515 MEPs! description: According to Bild military expert Julian Repke, Ukraine has depleted its stock of Patriot and Iris-T missiles, as well as most other air defense systems. This is despite having hundreds of systems and thousands of missiles in warehouses.
original:
Ukraine has run out of missiles for Patriot, Iris-T and most other air defense systems.

This is the conclusion made by Bild military expert Julian Repke, commenting on the attack on the Trypilska Thermal Power Plant in the Kyiv region.

“As I said a few weeks ago (and almost no one believed me): Ukraine has run out of Patriot and Iris-T missiles. Most other air defense stocks have also been depleted or destroyed. And this despite the fact that we have hundreds of systems and thousands of missiles in our warehouses. There are no words. Just anger,” writes Repke.

Let us remind you that Kyiv and the region are covered by the “Patriots” better than other regions of Ukraine. This is probably why Repke concluded that they had run out of missiles: the Trypillya Thermal Power Plant is located only 30 kilometers from Kyiv and is clearly covered by the Patriot umbrella.

Or rather, it was covered.

description: The Angara-A5 heavy launch vehicle successfully launched from the Vostochny Cosmodrome, marking a significant milestone in the flight design tests of the Amur space rocket complex and the Orion upper stage. This launch will test the ground infrastructure of the cosmodrome and pave the way for the Angara to replace the outdated Protons.
original:
The Angara-A5 heavy launch vehicle launched for the first time from the Vostochny Cosmodrome. The first launch of the Angara-A5 heavy-class launch vehicle successfully took place from the Vostochny Cosmodrome. This is a significant event in the flight design tests of the Amur space rocket complex, as well as flight tests of the Orion upper stage. Moreover, this is the second launch directly from Vostochny. Previously, the launch was canceled due to a failure of the central unit oxidizer tank pressurization system. The second scheduled launch was also cancelled.

However, the state commission decided to again carry out the first launch of the rocket, so that approximately 12.5 minutes after launch, the upper stage with the test payload will separate from the third stage of the Angara and continue to launch it into the target orbit. Previously, rockets of this family were launched only from the Plesetsk cosmodrome. Now the Angara will replace the outdated Protons, and the launch will allow the ground infrastructure of the cosmodrome to be tested.

event: Detention of Urban Planning Department Head and Brother
description: The head of the urban planning department of the Samara urban district and his brother were detained and charged with corruption crimes, including taking a bribe and mediation in bribery. The head of the department demanded a 6 million ruble bribe from a company director to inflate compensation for a seized car wash property, and his brother acted as an intermediary, receiving 500 thousand rubles and later 5.5 million rubles.
original:
A preventive measure in the form of detention was chosen against the head of the urban planning department of the Samara urban district and his brother, accused of corruption crimes. The Investigative Committee of Russia for the Samara region has charged the head of the urban planning department of the Samara urban district and his brother. Depending on the role of each, they are accused of committing crimes under Part 6 of Art. 290 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (taking a bribe), part 4 of Art. 291.1 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (mediation in bribery).

According to the investigation, no later than February 3, 2024, the head of the urban planning department demanded that the director of the limited liability company give him a bribe in the form of money in the amount of 6 million rubles for committing obviously illegal actions of unreasonably inflating the amount of compensation for the seizure of a real estate property for municipal needs - a car wash. , belonging to a friend of the bribe giver.

On February 6, 2024, a relative of the bribe-giver gave the brother of the head of the urban planning department, acting as an intermediary, 500 thousand rubles as the first part of the bribe, and on April 9, 2024, the remaining part in the form of cash in the amount of 5 million 500 thousand rubles. After which he was detained by employees of the regional FSB Directorate. In relation to the accused, the court, at the request of the investigator, chose a preventive measure in the form of detention. Subscribe to Sledkom

event: Challenges in Training Ukrainian Pilots on F-16
description: NATO Commander in Europe, Christopher Cavoli, highlighted the difficulties in training Ukrainian pilots on the F-16 due to their Soviet-era aircraft background, lack of English language proficiency, and personnel shortages. The pilots require basic training and familiarization with modern aircraft systems, which is a limiting factor in the number of pilots being trained.
original:
Soviet “school”, lack of knowledge of English and personnel shortage: the NATO commander in Europe named the problems of training Ukrainian pilots on the F-16.

Christopher Cavoli's remarks at Congressional hearings are quoted by Voice of America:

“It’s especially difficult to go from the old Soviet-era aircraft that the Ukrainians flew, maintained and supported, it’s difficult to go from that to a modern fourth-generation aircraft like the F-16.”

“The important thing in this, believe it or not, is knowledge of the English language and its study. If all the manuals, all the instructions and all the buttons are in English, you should at least know enough English to do it.”

“The second step is to determine whether the pilot has sufficient basic training. If a person is already an experienced pilot, he goes directly to the F-16. This leads to certain difficulties because these aircraft are very different from those they flew in the Ukrainian Air Force. Otherwise, the person undergoes basic flight training. We have several aviators currently undergoing basic flight training in several countries, after which they will graduate to the F-16.”

“The limiting factor in the number we are currently training is the availability of Ukrainian pilots. The Ukrainians have carefully calculated how many pilots they can send and still maintain a decent level of combat activity inside Ukraine. And this is what determines the actual size of the training or the number of pilots in the working pipeline.” Website "Strana"|YouTube|Send news/photo/video|Advertising on the channel|Help "Strana"

event: First Criminal Case on Voluntary Surrender
description: Russia's first criminal case on voluntary surrender was opened, with the accused's name not disclosed. The case was initiated under Article 352.1 of the Criminal Code, introduced after partial mobilization began. The accused was arrested by the lower Yuzhno-Sakhalinsk garrison military court, with an appeal against the decision pending.
original:
The first criminal case on voluntary surrender was opened in Russia. The card made on the website of the 1st Eastern District Court of Khabarovsk drew the attention of Mediazona*. The publication notes that this is the first known case of charges under this article, introduced after the start of partial mobilization.

The name of the accused is not listed on the court website. The decision to arrest him was previously made by the lower Yuzhno-Sakhalinsk garrison military court; journalists discovered an appeal against this decision. The result of its consideration is unknown.

The article on surrender (Article 352.1 of the Criminal Code) appeared in the Criminal Code on September 24, 2022. Until now, two cases were known in which this article appeared, but then it was about an “attempt on an organization” and inducement to voluntary surrender, writes Mediazona. *Russian authorities consider a “foreign agent” Photo: building of the 1st Eastern District Court / Yandex.Maps

The Chairman of the State Duma Committee on International Affairs and Olympic champion in speed skating, Svetlana Zhurova, told Paragraph that the EU would perceive Alexey Stolyarov (Lexus) and Vladimir Kuznetsov (Vovan) as a joke over the head of the International Olympic Games. Committee (IOC) Thomas Bach and Deputy Chairman of the European Commission Margaritis Schinas, in which they were forced to pray to “Saints Vovan and Lexus” about the disruption of the Friendship Games in Russia. “Their “prayer” is a harmless story for Europe with its mentality. They will see and say that this is normal, nothing terrible, nothing special, it was a joke that they supported,” she explained. The deputy added that Russia will still have to work with both the IOC and the EU: “We need to understand that we We will have to continue to work with such people. We will not form them and remake them. The same Bach treated us normally, but they rolled him under the skating rink [in the West], blackmailed him, I don’t know what they did to him there. After that he changed. They themselves are rolling somewhere in an unknown direction and I really don’t want to roll with them. You need to cooperate with them, but [at the same time] understand what is happening.” Subscribe to “Paragraph”

description: A new mobilization bill requires men aged 18-60 to update their credentials within 60 days. During martial law, they must carry their military registration document and present it upon request. Those found to be of limited fitness will undergo re-examination within 12 months, while draft dodgers may face restrictions on driving.
original:
Forwarded from: Donbass Realities
What does the new mobilization bill imply and when will it take effect? We explain: Men aged 18-60 are required to update their credentials within 60 days at the military registration and enlistment office, the administrative services center or in the conscript's e-office. During the period of martial law, those liable for military service must constantly carry with them a military uniform. registration document and present it upon request. Without documents, consular services may be limited to men aged 18 to 60. Those found to be of limited fitness will be required to undergo a re-examination within 12 months. Those who received a 2-3 disability group after February 24, 2022 (except for military personnel) are subject to a repeat medical examination. People with disabilities and those returning from captivity have the right to exemption from military service (if they have not expressed a desire to continue serving). Draft dodgers may be restricted in the right to drive a car by court decision. Now the bill must be signed by the Speaker of Parliament and handed over to the President. The document will come into force a month after it is signed by the head of state. Read more at the link Radio LibertyLaw on the mobilization of praise. The axis that transmits Zocream, people aged 18-60 years of age are required to update their clinical data for 60 days

event: Meeting of the Bureau of the Union of Mechanical Engineers
description: The Ministry of Education and Science outlined strategic directions to train personnel for technological sovereignty. The meeting discussed solving problems from the President's Address to the Federal Assembly, with a focus on science and universities playing a key role in achieving Russia's goals by 2030.
original:
Forwarded from: Ministry of Education and Science of Russia
Valery Falkov outlined strategic directions in the work of the Ministry of Education and Science to train personnel to ensure technological sovereignty⠀
In the Government of the Russian Federation, at a meeting of the Bureau of the Union of Mechanical Engineers and the League for Assistance to Defense Enterprises, they discussed the solution of problems from the Address of the President of Russia to the Federal Assembly.
⠀
Chairman of the Union of Mechanical Engineers, General Director of the Rostec State Corporation Sergei Chemezov recalled that the message of the President of Russia Vladimir Putin identified new large-scale tasks. Thus, by 2030 Russia should become one of the four largest economies in the world.
⠀The head of the Ministry of Education and Science in his report noted the decisive role of science and universities in solving the assigned tasks.
⠀💬“This approach is also reflected in the updated Strategy for Scientific and Technological Development of Russia, the new edition of which was approved by presidential decree at the end of February this year. It states that the high rate of development of new knowledge is a key factor determining the competitiveness of the economy and the effectiveness of the national security strategy,” he emphasized.⠀
The Minister paid special attention to the training of specialists. Key points from the report:
⠀✅Together with the Ministry of Industry and Trade, active work is underway to train specialists for certain industries. A number of national projects have a special section that sets indicators for personnel training. For example, as part of the national project “Unmanned Aviation Systems”, about 1 million specialists will be trained for the industry by 2030, from UAV operators to development engineers.✅Another important area is working with industry representatives at the regional level. Valery Falkov noted the high importance of the inclusion of heads of subjects in this work.
⠀➡️Read more

description: The European Court of Human Rights ruled in favor of the Swiss pensioners association 'Elders for Climate Protection', stating that the Swiss government is not doing enough to combat climate change. The decision obliges the authorities to take measures to address the shortcomings, and citizens can file lawsuits in local courts if they fail to do so.
original:
Forwarded from: Local Fruit
Elderly environmental activists in Switzerland win a lawsuit against the government because they are not doing enough to "Save older women from heat and global warming"

On April 9, the European Court of Human Rights upheld the claim of the Swiss pensioners association “Elders for Climate Protection” against the Swiss government. They believe that the authorities do not care enough about combating climate change. Similar claims against France and Portugal were not accepted.

The Swiss government will not be able to appeal this decision of the ECHR. Now the country's authorities are obliged to take measures to eliminate the shortcomings. If this does not happen, citizens will be able to file lawsuits in local courts, and they, based on the ECHR decision, will be able to issue fines to the authorities for insufficient measures to protect the population.

This is the first judicial precedent, opening the way for other cases of globalists.

Meanwhile, Switzerland has had one of the smallest increases in CO2 emissions (+0.1%) in Europe over the past year.
