description: The Verkhovna Rada adopted a law on mobilization, introducing new rules for Ukrainians liable for military service. Key provisions include updating information for the TCC, carrying military registration documents, and potential penalties for hiding from mobilization.
original:
The Verkhovna Rada adopted the law on mobilization in the second reading. According to the new rules: — All Ukrainians liable for military service will have to update their information for the TCC (the Ukrainian equivalent of military registration and enlistment offices) within 60 days after the law or decree on extending mobilization comes into force (it is expected on May 13). Failure to do this will result in a fine of up to 22.5 thousand hryvnia (about 53.5 thousand rubles).

— Previously recognized as partially fit for military service will have to undergo a new medical examination. Also, disabled people of groups 2 and 3, who were recognized as disabled after February 24, 2022, will have to pass the commission.

— All men in Ukraine will have to carry military registration documents with them, regardless of suitability for service and deferment. They will be able to be checked by the police, TCC workers and border guards. Without military IDs, consular services will also not be provided abroad.

— Those who are hiding from mobilization will be able to be deprived of their driver’s license through the courts. Also, cars will be able to be taken from their owners for the needs of the army, if the owner has several of them.

— Criminal liability will only be imposed for failure to appear on a summons to a collection point (up to 5 years in prison).

— There will be no demobilization after 36 months of service. Instead, those who received disability at the front or were released from captivity will apply for demobilization.

— Security forces, 50% of category B and C officials, employees of strategic and critically important enterprises and their beneficial owners (that is, large businessmen) will be subject to armor.

The law will come into force after Zelensky signs it. During its consideration in the first reading (at that time the bill contained provisions on blocking accounts and the obligation to establish a personal account for sending out subpoenas), after which the bill was finalized for two months.

Passengers of the Moscow metro were asked to choose for themselves what the future updated subway car should look like. The model will be launched in 2026 - it should become more spacious and will be able to move without a contact rail at all.

The survey of passengers was organized by the capital's department of transport. It started on April 8 and will last until April 16. As the organizers promise, its results will be carefully studied by designers and engineers when modeling the updated composition of Moscow-2030.

event: Zelensky Announces Plans to Destroy Kerch Bridge
description: Ukrainian President Zelensky stated in an interview with Bild that Ukraine plans to destroy the Kerch Bridge, as well as Russian military aviation airfields on the Crimean Peninsula, citing them as legitimate military targets.
original:
Zelensky announced the need to destroy the Kerch Bridge. This is how the Ukrainian leader answered in an interview with Bild when asked about Ukraine’s plans to destroy the Crimean Bridge this year.

“We really want to. And this question is not about what exactly the bridge is, the Kerch Bridge, which everyone is talking about. We are talking about several infrastructure things that are military targets,” the president said.

He added that Ukraine plans to destroy both the Kerch Bridge and Russian military aviation airfields on the peninsula from which planes fly and strike Ukraine. “Sorry, these are legitimate targets. And I’m already silent that they are located in the temporarily occupied territories of Ukraine,” Zelensky said.

event: Crimean Resident Accused of High Treason
description: Denis Narolsky, a Crimean resident, has been accused of high treason for refusing to fight against Ukraine. He was previously sentenced to nine years in prison for desertion. Narolsky was forcibly mobilized and appointed commander of a motorized rifle squad, but escaped after five days and headed home on foot.
original:
The Russian Federation has accused a Crimean citizen of high treason, who has been convicted for a year for refusing to fight against Ukraine. The Southern District Military Court in Rostov-on-Don is considering a criminal case against a Crimean resident Denis Narolsky, accused of high treason.

The man is already in a Russian prison: last year he was sentenced to nine years in prison for desertion.

Then the Russian occupiers forcibly mobilized the man and appointed him commander of a motorized rifle squad. However, after five days, Narolsky escaped from the military unit and headed on foot to his home.

A second criminal case was opened against Narolsky due to correspondence on his phone. According to Russian laws, a man can receive life imprisonment for high treason. Denis Aleksandrovich Narolsky was born on May 5, 1993, a Ukrainian, a resident of the Crimean village of Ivanovka, worked as a car mechanic, and has a young child.

event: Increase in Passenger Traffic at Kemerovo Airport
description: Kemerovo Airport saw a 10% increase in passenger traffic in the first quarter of 2024 compared to the same period in 2023, with 108,210 passengers. The airport added new flights to Samara, Ufa, and Mineralnye Vody, while international flights were absent due to runway reconstruction.
original:
Kemerovo Airport increased passenger traffic by 10% in the first quarter. Passenger traffic at Kemerovo Airport in January-March 2024 increased by 10% compared to the same period in 2023 and amounted to 108,210 thousand people. Interfax reports this with reference to data from the airport's press service.

“Since mid-January, new flights have been added to the cities of Samara, Ufa and Mineralnye Vody. In the same period in 2023, flights were operated to Omsk, Kazan, as well as international flights (Osh, Utapao). In January-March 2024, these destinations were absent,” - said at the airport.

event: Meeting of the Bureau of the Union of Mechanical Engineers of Russia
description: The meeting discussed the tasks set by President Vladimir Putin in his message to the Federal Assembly, focusing on national projects for technological sovereignty in key areas. Yuri Slyusar, General Director of PJSC UAC, highlighted the challenges faced by the industry, including the need for a domestic PLM environment, investment in Russian technological equipment, and a shortage of specialists.
original:
At a meeting of the Bureau of the Union of Mechanical Engineers of Russia and the League for Assistance to Defense Enterprises, they discussed the tasks set by the President of the Russian Federation Vladimir Putin in his message to the Federal Assembly, as well as the implementation of national projects of technological sovereignty in key areas.

In his speech, Yuri Slyusar, General Director of PJSC UAC, Vice President of SoyuzMash of Russia, identified among the current challenges for the industry the creation of a domestic PLM environment, the creation of which UAC has already begun together with domestic developers of engineering software, the need for investment in the development of Russian technological equipment and machines, which the aircraft industry needs, and a shortage of specialists. Speaking about personnel, he drew attention to the need to ensure a high social and living standard of the workspace and attractive social programs for workers. “People, especially young people, want to work in modern conditions. We must find sources of funding and allocate funds for this. We don't have many tools with which we can win the competition for labor resources. The housing program for workers of the defense industry, and the aircraft industry in particular, along with sustainable utilization of enterprises and wages, are the tools that will attract and retain people,” the head of the UAC concluded. More information about the issues discussed can be found here

description: Despite promises from local authorities to stop development, construction of the Kapranov beam continues in the village of Rossiysky, Aksai district. Residents are concerned about the environmental impact, but officials claim that the construction is legal and cannot be interfered with.
location: Rossiysky, Aksai District, Rostov Oblast, Russia
original:
Forwarded from: 161.RU | Rostov News
In the village of Rossiysky, Aksai district, construction of the Kapranov beam continues, despite promises from local authorities to stop the development.

The district administration promised residents that the land would be given over to agriculture, and they would try to turn the ravine itself into a water body, sending an appeal to the Ministry of Natural Resources.

But soon the equipment began to rustle near the beam again - the owners of the plots began to build houses. Frightened residents wrote to the head of the district administration, Vladimir Eremenko, that construction was continuing, and he sent administration employees to the beam. They checked the documents of the owner of the site and stated that “everything is legal” and they cannot interfere with construction. The officials who arrived said: “Well, what should we do? You understand, all this has already been purchased. They will sue us, they will knock us on the head, they will punish us severely.” I say: “Okay, let’s wait until everything here is cut down so that no one gets knocked on the head,” says local resident Elena Karimova. Administration employees began to assure residents that it is possible to build houses near the beam and there are no violations in this. According to the resident, officials simply do not see in dry weather what is happening here during the rains.

Seeing the forest belt stretching along the ravine, officials said that the trees were old and needed to be cut down further. Part of the forest belt has already been destroyed, and houses have been built in its place. The Ministry of Natural Resources, in response to a request from the editors @news161ru, reported that such a decision could lead to the destruction of vegetation and a violation of Water Law. Department employees sent the results of the inspection to the Aksai district prosecutor's office to “protest” the meeting’s decision deputies. But the visiting administration representatives heard about this for the first time.

description: Ukraine has adopted a new law on mobilization, which includes provisions such as the cancellation of demobilization for those already at the front, mandatory updating of personal data, and the requirement to carry military registration documents. original: A new law on mobilization has been adopted in Ukraine. Its main provisions:◾️for those who are already at the front, demobilization has been cancelled;◾️personal data must be updated in the TCC within 60 days after the adoption of the law;◾️a military registration document must be carried with you and shown by At the first request of a representative of the TCC or a police officer, photo and video recording will be carried out during the verification of documents;◾️The TCC will receive data from the Ministry of Internal Affairs on vehicles of citizens and enterprises for them to perform military transport duties; if an individual has more than one vehicle, one of them can be mobilized; they must be returned no later than a month after the announcement of demobilization;◾️for draft dodgers, driving rights, consular services and a temporary ban on travel are limited;◾️citizens of limited fitness must undergo a VLK, and those who received II - III disability groups must undergo a second medical examination after February 24, 2022 .@brd_nash

event: Constitution Day of the Republic of Crimea
description: Crimea celebrates Constitution Day, symbolizing unity, citizenship, and patriotism. The Constitution is the foundation of the republic's legal system, embodying the spirit and values of its people. Over the past decade, large-scale projects have been implemented, driving economic and social progress.
original: Today in Crimea they are celebrating Constitution Day of the Republic. According to Chairman of the Council of Ministers of the Republic of Kazakhstan Yuri Gotsanyuk, this significant date is a symbol of unity and cohesion, citizenship and patriotism. “The Constitution is the tuning fork of our entire legal system, the main document by which Crimea lives and develops. The Basic Law embodies the spirit, ideals and values of the multinational people of the republic,” Gotsanyuk said. He added that Crimea is a democratic, social state within Russia. Man, his rights and freedoms are the highest value. Over the past 10 years, large-scale projects have been implemented on the territory of the republic, a huge breakthrough has been made in the economy and social sphere. “All achievements are a projection of the strategic guidelines enshrined in our Constitution, which serves as the foundation for all transformations and reliably protects the interests of Crimeans and the republic. event: Presentation of Innovative Aircraft Assessment Method
description: TsAGI scientists presented a novel method for evaluating the technical condition of aircraft, utilizing mathematical processing of statistical data from in-flight measurements of airframe elements' dynamic characteristics. This approach can predict 'deep' processes leading to structural strength loss and is cost-effective, applicable to both metal and composite structures.
original:
TsAGI presented an innovative method for assessing the technical condition of aircraft, developed by scientists from the Central Aerohydrodynamic Institute named after Professor N.E. Zhukovsky (TsAGI, part of the N.E. Zhukovsky Institute) method is based on mathematical processing of statistical data from in-flight measurements of the dynamic characteristics of aircraft airframe elements.

It takes into account indicators such as changes in dynamic characteristics related to the precursors of aviation incidents. The information they contain is very valuable for predicting “deep” processes leading to loss of structural strength.

To do this, vibration responses under normalized influences are measured at key points. At the same time, presented at the international exhibition and conference “Aircraft Maintenance and Repair in Russia” has one key difference from other vibration inspection methods.

The latter usually use vibrators, while the TsAGI method creates an exciting force using standard aircraft controls. As experts note, the advantages of this approach lie in its low cost and the possibility of application not only on metal, but also on composite structures.📷TsAGI#PostfactumMAXimum Aviation:Telegram&MAX-2024Souvenirs&Clothing for those in love with the sky

event: Investigation into Ural Airlines Airbus A320 Incident
description: Rosaviation's investigation into the Ural Airlines Airbus A320 landing in a wheat field in the Novosibirsk region revealed complex problems in ensuring flight safety, including inadequate flight training and professional training of flight crew members. The investigation recommended the dismissal of two deputy general directors, citing their responsibility for the pilots' lack of knowledge and skills.
original:
Are Rosaviation's investigations reaching a new level? Having conducted a repeated* investigation into the reasons for the landing of the Ural Airlines Airbus A320 in a wheat field in the Novosibirsk region, the commission indicated that the fault lies not only with the two pilots who found themselves in the cockpit that day. Complex problems in ensuring flight safety were identified , organization of flight training work in the airline and professional training of flight crew members. The department recommended the dismissal of two deputy general directors of Sergei Skuratov - flight director Sergei Glazkov and quality director Alexei Fomin. In other words: if pilots do not have sufficient knowledge of aircraft systems, they find it difficult to calculate fuel and make decisions, and also experience difficulties in working interaction between themselves - it is the fault of those who prepared them, checked them and signed the permits.

The “reason” for leaving for Novosibirsk was clear for a long time - the recommendation conveyed to the crews on paper stated that in the event of a non-critical failure (failure of the green hydraulic system is just that), one of the airfields with an aviation technical base should be chosen for landing for speedy repairs .*the first report was canceled due to a number of inaccuracies, errors and incomplete descriptions. In this article we conducted a detailed analysis of the first investigation report.#inside_crashes_and_incidents You can benefit from supporting our content: subscribe to Boosty or the quiz channel. Thank you!

description: Senior police sergeant Ivan Sholokhov and junior police sergeant Vyacheslav Pupykin rescued a 64-year-old man from drowning in the icy waters of the Kitoy River in the Irkutsk region. The police officers risked their lives by crawling onto loose ice to pull the man out of the hole, and then carried him to the shore where he was handed over to doctors.
original:
❗️Minister of Internal Affairs of the Russian Federation Vladimir Kolokoltsev appealed to the President of the Russian Federation with a petition to award senior police sergeant Ivan Sholokhov and junior police sergeant Vyacheslav Pupykin with the medal “For saving the dead.” Eyewitnesses reported to the police that on the Kitoy River (Irkutsk region) an elderly man was drowning in icy water Human. Police patrol officers were near the scene of the incident and rushed to help the drowning man.

The 64-year-old man was in the middle of the river and clinging to the edge of thin ice with his hands. The police approached him as close as possible. Using available means, they tried to pull out the man who was losing strength. But it didn't work.

Then Ivan Sholokhov and Vyacheslav Pupykin rushed onto the loose ice and crawled to the water itself, took the fisherman by the hands and pulled him out of the hole.

Then, together with emergency workers, they carried him to the shore, where they handed him over to doctors. The victim was taken to a medical facility.@opersvodki

original:
A general meeting of the Omsk Association of Industrialists and Entrepreneurs was held at the site of the Siberian Devices and Systems enterprise.
The participants discussed the results of the regional industry for 2023 and outlined the tasks for the current year. At the end of 2023, positive dynamics of all economic indicators of the industry in the Omsk region were achieved. The industrial production index amounted to 104.2% (in Russia - 103.5%, Siberian Federal District - 98.6%).✅Tax revenues from industry to budgets of all levels increased 1.3 times, reaching 227 billion rubles.✅The number of industry workers as a whole increased by 1,400 people - up to 106.3 thousand people.✅Average wage the fee increased by 21% to 65 thousand rubles.✅More than 100 billion rubles of investment were invested in industrial development over the past year.

description: Russian special services detained Antonina Martynova, wife of Novaya Gazeta Europe's editor-in-chief Kirill Martynov, on suspicion of attempted murder of her own daughter. The case against her was resumed in the Novgorod Regional Court, allegedly as a means to blackmail and recruit Kirill Martynov for Russian propaganda purposes.
original:
In Russia, journalists' wives are taken hostage. The wife of the editor-in-chief of Novaya Gazeta Europe, Antonina Martynova, was detained on suspicion of attempted murder of her own daughter.

In the Stavropol Territory, Russian special services officers detained Antonina Martynova, suspected of attempted murder of her own daughter, media reports. The wife of the editor-in-chief of Novaya Gazeta Europe, Kirill Martynov, was put on the wanted list back in 2007. According to the prosecution, she allegedly deliberately pushed her two-year-old daughter on the staircase - as a result of the blow, the girl fell, broke her jaw and received a head injury. Martynova argued that the girl tripped herself, but witnesses then pointed to the guilt of the editor-in-chief’s wife. In 2008, Antonina was found guilty by a jury and, under recognizance not to leave the place, left Russia. Pro-government publications claim that she has been wanted since then. Now the case against Martynova has been resumed in the Novgorod Regional Court.

Obviously, the purpose of the arrest is to take hostage a close friend of the editor-in-chief of Novaya Gazeta.Europe, Kirill Martynov, for the purpose of blackmail and possible recruitment for using the famous media outlet as a tool of Russian propaganda. We know that previously the FSB, through third parties, transferred fabricated materials to Martynov for publication in order to discredit the founder of Gulagu.net, Vladimir Osechkin, and tried to use him in the fall of 2023 in a campaign against us, but after fact-checking and verification, Martynov refused to publish these materials and did not help counterintelligence FSB in this special operation.

Our words of support to Kirill and Antonina Martynov and the entire team of “Novaya Gazeta. Europe”!🕊✊And once again to everyone who can - U E Z J A Y T E. Don’t become hostages and take care of yourself and all of us, please.

description: The former deputy director of MKU Makhachkalaproduct will face trial for accepting bribes. He allegedly received 615,000 rubles from educational institution heads in exchange for unverified product deliveries.

Forwarded from: Prosecutor's Office of the Republic of Dagestan
The former deputy director of MKU "Makhachkalaproduct" will appear in court on charges of accepting bribes. The prosecutor's office of the republic approved an indictment in a criminal case against the former deputy director of MKU "Makhachkalaproduct". He is accused under paragraph “a” of Part 5 of Art. 290 (taking a bribe) and Part 1 of Art. 291.2 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (petty bribery).

According to the investigation, from September 2021 to February 2022, a man holding the specified position, in collusion with other officials of MKU Makhachkalaproduct, received funds in the form of bribes from the heads of educational institutions, in a total amount of 615 thousand rubles, for deliveries without checking the volumes of requested products.

original: 🇾🇪Yemen refused lucrative US offers for the sake of Palestine. The US wanted to make significant concessions to the Yemeni Houthis, but were refused because of Palestine. Although the Biden Administration offered very tempting and interesting offers to the Houthi government of Yemen in exchange for its neutrality in the conflict in Palestine, stopping hitting Western and Israeli courts . Here are the main ones: The US will demand that Saudi Arabia and the UAE sign peace with the Houthis. Lifting the naval and air blockade on Yemen, opening the airports and ports of the Arab Republic for international flights. Payment of salaries and pensions to Yemeni government employees. The US promised to compensate for the economic damage caused by the war and invasion the Saudis with their coalition. Withdrawal of all occupation forces from the entire territory of Yemen. Recognition of the Houthis as the legitimate government of Yemen by the States. Lifting of all international economic sanctions against Yemen. Clear international security guarantees for the territorial integrity of Yemen, preventing the use of military force against it. Despite these tempting offers that were the subject of negotiations between Sanoa and Riyadh for more than 2 years, the Yemenis remained steadfast and true to their word to all Arabs and Palestinians that they would fight for the freedom of Palestine until their last breath. The main conditions the Houthis call is the cessation of Zionist aggression in the Gaza Strip, guarantees of an end there fire, guarantees for the safe entry of humanitarian aid into the region, as well as the withdrawal of occupation forces from there.

description: The Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine adopted a bill tightening mobilization conditions and increasing responsibility for draft dodgers. Key provisions include updating data at military registration offices within 60 days, considering summons received without personal delivery, and requiring men aged 18-60 to wear military identification cards.
original:
Today, the Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine adopted in the second reading a scandalous bill on tightening the conditions for mobilization and increasing responsibility for draft dodgers.

Previously, Vladimir Zelensky, in separate laws, had already adopted some provisions of this major bill, such as lowering the age of conscripts from 27 to 25 years, as well as the introduction of an electronic conscript office and the abolition of the category of “limitedly fit.” Briefly about the new key provisions of the adopted law:

— Those liable for military service have 60 days to update their data at the military registration and enlistment offices, or sanctions will follow, including monetary fines and restrictions on rights.

— The summons will be considered received without the fact of personal delivery, but simply at the moment of recording the impossibility of its delivery.

— All men from 18 to 60 years old will be required to wear military identification cards.

— Almost all law enforcement agencies of Ukraine, as well as assistants to deputies and owners of strategic enterprises, received reservations from mobilization. Disabled people, students and graduate students will receive a deferment.

— The rule on the demobilization of military personnel after 36 months of service is excluded.

If Zelensky signs the law soon, its provisions will begin to take effect in a month - approximately by mid-May 2024, at which time the next active wave of mobilization under the new rules will begin in Ukraine. Military Informant

description: The Tretyakov Gallery is hosting an exhibition of Han Yuchen's works, showcasing his contemporary Chinese art. The exhibition is part of the Russia-China Cross Years of Culture and features the artist's depictions of Tibet, highlighting the region's landscapes and traditional way of life.
original:
Forwarded from: Olga Lyubimova
A unique exhibition “Tibet. Han Yuchen at the Tretyakov Gallery “This important event is part of the events of the cross Years of Culture of Russia - China. The Tretyakov Gallery became one of the first Russian museums to present the works of an outstanding contemporary Chinese master in its halls.

The main theme of Han Yuchen's work is Tibet, an amazing mountainous region in southwest China. The artist is attracted by both the magnificent landscapes and the color of the traditional way of life of the local residents.

In his works, the master reflects what he saw with reliable accuracy. This will allow every guest of the exhibition, especially those who have not been to the region, to get acquainted with the real Tibet. Understand the artist’s love for these places.

Separately, I would like to note the generous gift of Han Yuchen to the Tretyakov Gallery - this is the painting “A Thousand Psalms and Parables.” I am sure that the painting will become an adornment of the museum’s collection.

The exhibition will open to visitors tomorrow. And it will work until May 19.

description: The Angara-5 rocket successfully launched a payload into the intended orbit, marking its first launch with a payload. The Ministry of Defense was the customer, hinting at the ownership of the satellites. The rocket's modular design allows it to adapt to different payloads, reducing production and launch costs.
original:
The latest heavy Russian rocket, Angara-5, created after the collapse of the USSR, launched a payload into the intended orbit. And this is the first launch of the Angara-A5 with a payload; before this, mass-sized mock-ups were launched to test components and assemblies. I heartily congratulate the entire team involved in the creation, production and launch. This is the fourth launch of the heavy Angara, all launches were successful (December 27, 2021, during the test launch of the Angara A-5.3L, the Perseus upper stage did not work in orbit, but the rocket itself worked normally). The customer, as in previous times, was the Ministry of Defense, which hints at the ownership of the satellites planned for launch into orbit.

Telemetry is as follows: 3 min 34 s - separation of the first stage of the rocket; 5 min 25 s - separation of the second stage of the rocket; 5 min 39 s - reset of the fairing flaps; 12 min 26 s - separation of the upper stage with payload.

This is the first launch of the Angara family from the new Vostochny cosmodrome, which was also built through pain. Before that we flew from Plesetsk.

For the first time in Russian space, "Angara" is made according to a modular design. Depending on the required payload, launch modules are added and it changes from “light” to “heavy”. And the launch mass from 3.5 tons (Angara-1.2) increases to 38 tons (Angara-A5V) in low Earth orbit. Moreover, this is essentially the same rocket, which greatly reduces the cost of both production and preparation for launch.

Before this, the light Angara-1.2 flew three times, all times successfully, and the heavy Angara-A5 flew three times. The statistics are very good, considering that the rocket is new and is made according to a fundamentally new modular design.
